M87 a.k.a. Virgo A.Notes: This is very large round galaxy known as an elliptical galaxy. It has powerful jets made of plasma that are a result of a supermassive black hole in the center and seen in radio wavelengths. The jet extends for about 5,000 light years.
captions: Messier object 87 by Hubble space telescope
alt=M87 black hole is a strong source of radio waves
alt=Visible wavelength image of Virgo cluster with M87 located near lower left
alt=stellar velocities in M87 are somewhat random, as opposed to more circular velocities in spirals
alt= Hubble classified galaxies according to their shape: ellipticals, lenticulars and spirals. Ellipticals and spirals have further categories.
alt=Images showing helical flow of matter in M87 jet
alt=Supermassive black holes are surrounded by massive accretion disks and generate jets of plasma
alt=Central bright region of M87 is surrounded by diffuse, fainter halo
